intro: Chondrophylla americana, commonly known as American chondrophylla, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or yellow flowers bloom in late spring. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
